statement: The idea would be stronger if it clarified how inflammation and Wnt signaling are conceptually linked to bone resorption and formation, for example by incorporating bone turnover markers.

The idea does not clearly address whether prior as well as current antiresorptive medication use conceptually confounds the interpretation, raising questions about how well the exclusion criteria support the claim.
The idea could be better grounded if it conceptually considered the role of the Wnt inhibitor Dkk1 in the gene expression framework, since omitting it leaves the rationale incomplete.
The idea relies conceptually on mRNA expression as a proxy, but without engaging with protein-level validation it remains uncertain whether the proposed link is robust.

A major conceptual concern is that the proposed mechanism—alterations in circulating and bone factors leading to impaired bone quality—seems inconsistent with preserved bone mass in T2DM, making it unclear how the idea explains impaired quality without loss of mass.
